alert.note: Alert for Western Columbia Basin (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued July 03 at 8:54AM PDT until July 03 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...Gusty north winds and very dry conditions Monday... Very dry conditions with combine with breezy to gusty northerly winds on Monday through the Okanogan Valley, Waterville Plateau, and Western Columbia Basin. New fire starts will have the potential to spread rapidly. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM PDT THIS EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR WESTERN COLUMBIA BASIN... * Affected Area: Fire Weather Zone 707 Western Columbia Basin (Zone 707). * Winds: North 12 to 20 mph with gusts up to 30 mph. * Relative Humidities: 8 to 15 percent. * Impacts: Rapid fire spread with any new fire starts.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now....or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
